title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under Part D of title III of the Public Health Service Act. This program aims to support frontline health care services by offering loan repayment for providers. The Secretary will establish a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program where individuals agree to serve as health professionals for at least 2 years in a care scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayments. To be eligible, individuals must submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary for approval. Preference is given to applicants with interdisciplinary studies background, and the Secretary determines the care scarcity areas for placement. The Secretary gives preference to areas with interdisciplinary health care programs or plans for community health care. Written notice is provided upon approval for participation in the Loan Repayment Program. The contract includes an agreement for student loan repayment. The Secretary gives preference to areas with interdisciplinary health care programs or plans for community health care. Written notice is provided upon approval for participation in the Loan Repayment Program. The individual with student loan repayment agrees to provide frontline care services for a period of full-time service of not less than 2 years at a health care facility serving a frontline care scarcity area. The Secretary determines the amount of annual student loan repayment under this section to recruit health care providers. The individual must fulfill a 2-year full-time service commitment in a frontline care scarcity area. The Secretary may contract with an individual's loan provider for the payment of student loan repayments. If the individual breaches the contract by not fulfilling their service obligation, the United States can recover the total amount paid under the contract plus interest. The term 'frontline care scarcity area' refers to an area, population group, or facility designated as a health professional shortage area or by the State as lacking frontline care services. 'Frontline care services' include various health care services in different fields such as general surgery, optometry, physical therapy, and radiologic technology. Authorized appropriations for carrying out the section include $78,000,000 for fiscal year 2010 and $93,000,000 for fiscal year 2011. The services must be provided by a range of healthcare professionals who have completed accredited programs in the United States. For fiscal years 2011 to 2015, the appropriations are $93,000,000, $108,000,000, $123,000,000, $138,000,000, and $153,000,000 respectively. Starting from 2016, the amount will be adjusted based on the average percentage increase in health professions education costs. The Secretary is required to implement the loan repayment program within 180 days of enactment.
